pullRequest.title: DB-10483 Support DEC and DECIMAL functions
pullRequest.bodyText:
Implementation of DB2 DECIMAL and DEC functions is provided in this PR. These functions allow the user to create decimal object from almost any other object such as time, timestamp, varchar, integer and so on.
To get more details about these functions visit DB2's documentation and take a look at the tests in this PR.

commit.message: DB-10483 ascii art, make multiary function node table human-readable.

nodes.bodyText: I think you can remove that reference. We will have our own documentation.
Why not construct a SQLDecimal directly from the string?
Isn't this removing the decimalCharacter? How do we use it later?
Please restore this, otherwise we are going to generate lots of files on mem builds

                             <value>true</value>
                         </systemProperty>
-                        <!-- Uncomment the following to dump activation class files for mem platform to the mem_sql directory.

nodes.bodyText:
After seeing the ITs I think you are using as "digit group separator" but I'm pretty sure it's supposed to be the "fractional separator". From the docs:

it can appear at most once in string-expression

and

Digits are truncated from the end of the decimal number if the number of digits to the right of the decimal separator character is greater than the scale scale. An error is returned if the number of significant digits to the left of the decimal character (the whole part of the number) in string-expression is greater than precision - scale
